title: [Terminal] Support Fast Scrolling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Feature Request Editor supports increased scrolling speed while holding Alt key. It allows to scroll 1000 lines in 2 mouse wheel turns. ```json "editor.fastScrollSensitivity": 5, ``` It works in `Editor` and all `Tree`s. Is it possible to have it working for terminal?

title: stupidly large files
body:
OK, don't ask why but I need to open a 16GB file to do some editing to and cant find a program that will let me so I thought I would try vscode, it obviously didn't work which is why I'm here so I was wondering if it would be possible (after at least 3 years of it being mentioned in other posts) to it being added in, my computer currently has 48GB of ram so plenty to open it even if it needed double the file size in ram but even when I do give the software the ram I still get an error saying "cant open file is too large(16GB)" if this is unable to be added in (ideally soon) does anyone know of a program that would allow me to open a file this large in a way that I can mess with the code?
the file is a .VNEM and .VMDK file, most other files I have needed to open have done so

title: backlog of twitter issues
body:
Collecting a series of issues raised on [twitter](https://twitter.com/abyrd89/status/1155539665119637504?s=20).

- [ ] Debugging in C++ (~6)
 ...
- [ ] Code folding (~6)
 ...

- [ ] Regex doesn't work properly
- [ ] Quick Open is so slow, can see individual characters appearing
- [ ] 🏃 Can't snap the window properly in windows

Issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/58745
Win+L/R do not work properly upon restart if VS Code is closed while being snapped left or right. Proper Windows behavior seems to be to not restore in the snapped state.  Checking to see if this is something I can PR.

- [x] Fix the keybindings for Find in Files

> The keybindings one is about how awkward the defaults are. Up/Dn change the search contents rather than moving focus to the results which is vastly more likely. Ctrl+Dn moves to results but Ctrl+Up doesn't return to the search box in 99% of cases.

* Alt+Up/Down used to be the way to scroll search history, but people were expecting Up/Down (Sublime, Atom, see https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/23099 as an example)
* Using keybindings is the right way to override this behavior, so capturing it here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/78655  

- [x] Can't toggle maximized editors

Fixed with https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/72968, would be even better with https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/73453

- [ ] Reporting issues is a time sink

title: Support fontStyle "strikethrough" about theme
body:
Feature Request.

## Request
Currently v1.36.1, supported fontStyles in theme customization are `bold`, `italic` and `underline`.

But I want to use `strikethrough` too. like this:

```json
		{
			"name": "FinishedTaks",
			"scope": [
				"task.fiinshed"
			],
			"settings": {
				"foreground": "#ffff00",
				"fontStyle" : "strikethrough"
			}
		}
```

## FYI
VSCode sources:

-  [src/vs/editor/common/modes/supports/tokenization.ts#L63](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/013501950e78b9dde5c2e6ec3f2ddfb9201156b7/src/vs/editor/common/modes/supports/tokenization.ts#L63)
- [src/vs/editor/common/modes.ts#L70](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/aba87f135229c17c4624341b7a2499dcedafcb87/src/vs/editor/common/modes.ts#L70)

TextMate source:

- [Frameworks/theme/src/theme.cc#L76](https://github.com/textmate/textmate/blob/b17253ae035978964ae3d137a847554d211caff7/Frameworks/theme/src/theme.cc#L76)

TextMate supports strikethrough.

title: VSCode reliably crashing on Fedora 30
body:
Attempting to run VSC at all leads to an immediate crash. I've had this reliably happen with both the Stable and Insiders builds of VSC. Running `code --verbose` results in the following output: https://pastebin.com/xvVEV45V

In both tests, I had a clean install of VSC on version 1.36.1, on Fedora 30.

body:
- Clone and run the extension
- Run "Open JS Fiddle"
- Pick "demo"
- Pick some folder
- That folder is added to the workspace with some `.jsfiddle` file but nothing else happens, there is no source control provider in the source control viewlet
- Run "Refresh JS Fiddle status"

When I run "Open JS Fiddle" I see writeFile in `saveConfiguration` calling its error callback with `null` even though it seemed to write the file successfully. Then the debug session terminates and it seems that the EH is hung or crashed.

title: Color profiles other than sRGB cause major performance issues
body:
Issue Type: Performance Issue Performance of the buffer is severly degraded when the system color profile is set to anything other than sRGB. I believe this is related to an underlying issue with Chromium ([821020](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=821020), [791828](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=791828), [989904](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=989904)). There is a workaround in some other Chromium-based apps (e.g., Chrome), which allow the profile off the app to be distinct from the system profile. I have not been able to figure out a way to provide such an override with VS Code. Until the issue with Chromium is fixed, having the ability to set the color profile specifically for VS Code would be extermely helpful. title: Allow easy accepting/rejecting changes from both versions on save conflict
body:
This is the same as #47250 which is closed and locked, but I will try to explain in more detail.

Normally when there is an SCM merge conflict I can do a side by side comparison, can navigate conflicts one by one and can choose which version to keep (or to keep both) by using commands or buttons on the UI in addition to manual editing.

However, when there is a save conflict (the file I am trying to save has been modified elsewhere since I opened it) I get an error. I can then click "Compare" and get a side-by-side comparison. I can navigate differences with the arrows on top of the editor but crucially *I have to manually copy and paste wanted changes from the on-disk version onto the VS Code version* if I want to keep them.  There are buttons that allow *accepting my changes* and *discarding my changes*, which are both all-or-nothing operations; there is no easy way to merge a bit of both. 

Instead, it would be nice to have buttons/commands that allow accepting changes one at a time, from either source in the same way as a merge conflict.

title: Run VSCode tasks in a single session

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I would like to migrate my local deployment commands to VSCode task. I need to run them as root. When I did those in the terminal, I was asked to provide the password only once.

```
$ sudo echo hello                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
[sudo] password for pt12lol: 
hello
$ sudo echo hello                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
hello
```

Unfortunately when I configured my VSCode task:

```
{
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "label": "Hello task",
            "type": "shell",
            "command": "sudo echo hello"
        }
    ]
}
```

I suppose it runs every task in a separate session, and I am asked to provide my password every single time.

```
> Executing task: sudo echo hello <

[sudo] password for pt12lol: 
hello

Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it.

> Executing task: sudo echo hello <

[sudo] password for pt12lol: 
hello

Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it.
```

I would like to set up tasks deployment so that it keeps last sessions and I am not asked for my password every single time.

title: Add predefined variable ${fileDirBasename}

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Hello, I have some dotnet solutions opened as my root workspace.

For example:

${workspaceFolder}:
/home/username/dotnet-solution1

${file}:
/home/username/dotnet-solution1/project1/Program.cs
/home/username/dotnet-solution1/project2/Program.cs
/home/username/dotnet-solution1/project3/Program.cs
/home/username/dotnet-solution1/project4/Program.cs

When I open Program.cs or other cs file, I want press F5 to debug the corresponding project.

So I need this ${fileDirBasename} variable.

this is my expected lanunch config:

```
{
    "name": "Launch current project",
    "type": "coreclr",
    "request": "launch",
    "preLaunchTask": "build",
    "program": "${fileDirname}/bin/Debug/netcoreapp2.0/${fileDirBasename}.dll",
    "args": [],
    "cwd": "${fileDirname}",
    "stopAtEntry": false,
    "console": "internalConsole"
}
```

my expected build task:

```json
{
    "label": "build",
    "command": "dotnet",
    "type": "process",
    "args": [
        "build",
        "${fileDirname}/${fileDirBasename}.csproj",
        "/property:GenerateFullPaths=true",
        "/consoleloggerparameters:NoSummary"
    ],
    "problemMatcher": "$msCompile"
}
```

VSCode Version: 1.36.1
OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Running on Virtual Box(Version 6.0.10 r132072 (Qt5.6.2)).


**Steps to Reproduce:**

title: Add test or general spinning status to status bar
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
My usecase is I have a TS project, and besides having VSCode checking my code using tsserver, I also ran **`tsc --watch`** on the side to instantly emit code.

I was having issues with compilation speed of tsc, and the thing is, after changing my code and as soon as tsserver finishes type checking the code, I want to run it (the emitted JS) right away, but cannot since TSC hasn't finished built yet. 

It takes about 3-4 seconds to finish the incremental compilation. So I have to constantly switch between the `Problems` panel and `Terminal` to make sure TSC finishes the build.

The idea is having the `problemMatcher` config to include status matching as well, for example, 
- as soon as `File change detected. Starting incremental compilation...` shows up in the build task's output, we know TSC is building
- after error/success message shows up, we know it's finished. This can be reflected on the status bar, so that I don't have to switch to terminal panel to make sure TSC is done.

I asked on forum and get back the answer of no such extension/thing exists yet to solve the specific problem. Also I imagine this would benefit other languages/environments as well, for example, 
- webserver restart after changing the code 
  * this applies to all environments as long as there's anchor texts, and the good thing is, it's totally customizable
- Continuous unit test run
- Scala's continuous build with sbt

Just to name a few. I can see this being useful for many users as well.

title: Freeze when collecting search result
body:
Issue Type: Bug Using find in files feature, type "iris" on the search input. For other keywords are fine (even with more larger search result). Not yet find another keyword which will cause the freeze. title: Add a "Toggle Word Wrap" button to the Output window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Visual Studio's Output window has a "Toggle Word Wrap" button, but VS Code has word wrapping always (?) enabled. For certain scenarious like the pending "C/C++ References" output it is desirable for word wrapping to be disabled for the results to be more easily read. There is a "View: Toggle Word Wrap" command, but it applies to the active document only (and not the Output panel, even if it's active).

And/or if the OutputChannel interface could add a toggleWordWrap capability, that would allow extensions to set an appropriate default for their particular Output channel.

This seems like a pretty basic feature that other Output channel providers would want, but I couldn't find an existing feature request on this.

title: String Settings UI: Multiple edits loses data on Save
body:
Testing #77427

I can put multiple settings into edit mode. When pressing "Enter" to commit an entry, the data from the other settings is lost.  Probably should only allow for editing of one setting at a time.

Repro:

* search for `validProper` settings to show the three `Valid Properties` settings:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62175273-e5932900-b2f1-11e9-9d6f-e80f26142eb1.png)

* Click "Add Item" on each one, add a value to each:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62175278-edeb6400-b2f1-11e9-951c-ead03a0f973a.png)

* With focus in the 3rd item, press "Enter" to commit the edit.  Result is that edit is committed, but the data from the others is lost:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62175287-fa6fbc80-b2f1-11e9-9bef-43ed436e2426.png)

Suggest that you can only edit one setting at a time.

title: Settings UI: When "Add Item" out of view port, have to click 2x
body:
testing #77427

When editor is zoomed in, pressing the "Add Item" button scrolls the settings to the top and it does not go into edit mode.

Steps to repro:

1. zoom in vscode  a few times
2. open settings ui and search for `skipshell`.  this setting has a very long description, so you can't see the "Add Item" button, like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62174698-baa7d580-b2ef-11e9-81aa-e64a34d5e6dd.png)

3. Scroll down and click on the "Add Item" button

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62174715-cb584b80-b2ef-11e9-8eba-46dd367913d9.png)

Result: Settings scroll back to the top

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62174736-d9a66780-b2ef-11e9-8540-da33f03265ef.png)

And if you scroll down again, you can see that the "Add Item" button is still there, I have to click it again to get the input field.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62174776-f2168200-b2ef-11e9-8571-c68634a90f42.png)

If i click the "Add Item" button again, it then goes into edit mode

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1487073/62174797-022e6180-b2f0-11e9-9883-383275658ced.png)

You can "reset" this by toggling to `json` view

title: Emmet wrap empty lines
body:

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.36.1 (user setup)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home x64

Steps to Reproduce:

![emmet-wrap-empty-lines](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3883054/62165197-93202f80-b326-11e9-9ddd-aa263586480a.gif)

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes**
